name: Zero-to-One Operator
description: Proven hands-on experience building operational systems from scratch in early-stage, high-growth startups, demonstrating a "diagnose, build, then scale" mindset. High-agency problem solver who can flex from strategy to execution.

excellent: Founded venture-backed company with traction (£100K+ ARR, Series A+, or exit)
First 10 employees at startup reaching product-market fit
Built entirely new functions/business units from zero
good: Early founding team (first 20-50 hires) with meaningful traction
Led 0→1 initiatives requiring building infrastructure from scratch
weak: Joined post-Series B when processes existed
notAFit: 5+ years exclusively at Fortune 500 with no startup involvement
Junior/mid-level roles without demonstrable startup experience

name: Technical T-Shape
description: Sufficient technical or analytical depth to partner with engineers on product and small-scale automation. AI power user who actively uses AI tools to 10x output.

excellent: Professional engineering/data experience shipping production systems at Series A+ startups
Led analytics or ML product work at scale (1M+ users or Series B+)
good: Strong data/analytics with applied product experience at tech companies or funded startups
Comfortable prototyping automation and discussing technical trade-offs
weak: Academic technical background without productised outcomes
IT support or general tech roles without deep analytical contribution
notAFit: Uncomfortable with technical concepts or unable to work with engineers
Non-STEM background without compensating analytical achievements

name: Recruitment Mastery
description: Deep expertise in end-to-end recruitment, particularly within early-stage or high-growth technology companies. Built and optimised hiring pipelines from scratch.

excellent: Built 0→1 recruiting function (e.g., first 50 hires) at early-stage tech
Created systems and optimized metrics (30%+ time-to-hire reduction, 20%+ offer acceptance improvement)
good: Filled eg 5+ roles annually with end-to-end ownership (sourcing → offer)
Clear examples of managing hiring processes
weak: Involved in recruiting but limited end-to-end ownership
Indicators like "interviewed candidates," "supported hiring," "grew team through network" (informal)
notAFit: No evidence of recruiting at all
CV has zero mention of hiring or interviewing
